gurmukhi: rwmklI mhlw 3 AnMdu
transliteration: Raamakalee Mehalaa 3 Anandhu
translation: Raamkalee, Third Mehl, Anand ~ The Song Of Bliss:

gurmukhi: < siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ik Oankaar Sathigur Prasaadh ||
translation: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

gurmukhi: AnMdu BieAw myrI mwey siqgurU mY pwieAw ]
transliteration: Anandh Bhaeiaa Maeree Maaeae Sathiguroo Mai Paaeiaa ||
translation: I am in ecstasy, O my mother, for I have found my True Guru.

gurmukhi: siqguru q pwieAw shj syqI min vjIAw vwDweIAw ]
transliteration: Sathigur Th Paaeiaa Sehaj Saethee Man Vajeeaa Vaadhhaaeeaa ||
translation: I have found the True Guru, with intuitive ease, and my mind vibrates with the music of bliss.

gurmukhi: rwg rqn prvwr prIAw sbd gwvx AweIAw ]
transliteration: Raag Rathan Pravaar Pareeaa Sabadh Gaavan Aaeeaa ||
translation: The jewelled melodies and their related celestial harmonies have come to sing the Word of the Shabad.

gurmukhi: sbdo q gwvhu hrI kyrw min ijnI vswieAw ]
transliteration: Sabadho Th Gaavahu Haree Kaeraa Man Jinee Vasaaeiaa ||
translation: The Lord dwells within the minds of those who sing the Shabad.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku AnMdu hoAw siqgurU mY pwieAw ]1]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Anandh Hoaa Sathiguroo Mai Paaeiaa ||1||
translation: Says Nanak, I am in ecstasy, for I have found my True Guru. ||1||

gurmukhi: ey mn myirAw qU sdw rhu hir nwly ]
transliteration: Eae Man Maeriaa Thoo Sadha Rahu Har Naalae ||
translation: O my mind, remain always with the Lord.

gurmukhi: hir nwil rhu qU mMn myry dUK siB ivswrxw ]
transliteration: Har Naal Rahu Thoo Mann Maerae Dhookh Sabh Visaarana ||
translation: Remain always with the Lord, O my mind, and all sufferings will be forgotten.

gurmukhi: AMgIkwru Ehu kry qyrw kwrj siB svwrxw ]
transliteration: Angeekaar Ouhu Karae Thaeraa Kaaraj Sabh Savaarana ||
translation: He will accept You as His own, and all your affairs will be perfectly arranged.

gurmukhi: sBnw glw smrQu suAwmI so ikau mnhu ivswry ]
transliteration: Sabhanaa Galaa Samarathh Suaamee So Kio Manahu Visaarae ||
translation: Our Lord and Master is all-powerful to do all things, so why forget Him from your mind?

gurmukhi: khY nwnku mMn myry sdw rhu hir nwly ]2]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Mann Maerae Sadha Rahu Har Naalae ||2||
translation: Says Nanak, O my mind, remain always with the Lord. ||2||

gurmukhi: swcy swihbw ikAw nwhI Gir qyrY ]
transliteration: Saachae Saahibaa Kiaa Naahee Ghar Thaerai ||
translation: O my True Lord and Master, what is there which is not in Your celestial home?

gurmukhi: Gir q qyrY sBu ikCu hY ijsu dyih su pwvey ]
transliteration: Ghar Th Thaerai Sabh Kishh Hai Jis Dhaehi S Paaveae ||
translation: Everything is in Your home; they receive, unto whom You give.

gurmukhi: sdw isPiq slwh qyrI nwmu min vswvey ]
transliteration: Sadha Sifath Salaah Thaeree Naam Man Vasaaveae ||
translation: Constantly singing Your Praises and Glories, Your Name is enshrined in the mind.

gurmukhi: nwmu ijn kY min visAw vwjy sbd Gnyry ]
transliteration: Naam Jin Kai Man Vasiaa Vaajae Sabadh Ghanaerae ||
translation: The divine melody of the Shabad vibrates for those, within whose minds the Naam abides.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku scy swihb ikAw nwhI Gir qyrY ]3]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sachae Saahib Kiaa Naahee Ghar Thaerai ||3||
translation: Says Nanak, O my True Lord and Master, what is there which is not in Your home? ||3||

gurmukhi: swcw nwmu myrw AwDwro ]
transliteration: Saachaa Naam Maeraa Aadhhaaro ||
translation: The True Name is my only support.

gurmukhi: swcu nwmu ADwru myrw ijin BuKw siB gvweIAw ]
transliteration: Saach Naam Adhhaar Maeraa Jin Bhukhaa Sabh Gavaaeeaa ||
translation: The True Name is my only support; it satisfies all hunger.

gurmukhi: kir swˆiq suK min Awie visAw ijin ieCw siB pujweIAw ]
transliteration: Kar Saanth Sukh Man Aae Vasiaa Jin Eishhaa Sabh Pujaaeeaa ||
translation: It has brought peace and tranquility to my mind; it has fulfilled all my desires.

gurmukhi: sdw kurbwxu kIqw gurU ivthu ijs dIAw eyih vifAweIAw ]
transliteration: Sadha Kurabaan Keethaa Guroo Vittahu Jis Dheeaa Eaehi Vaddiaaeeaa ||
translation: I am forever a sacrifice to the Guru, who possesses such glorious greatness.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku suxhu sMqhu sbid Drhu ipAwro ]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sunahu Santhahu Sabadh Dhharahu Piaaro ||
translation: Says Nanak, listen, O Saints; enshrine love for the Shabad.

gurmukhi: swcw nwmu myrw AwDwro ]4]
transliteration: Saachaa Naam Maeraa Aadhhaaro ||4||
translation: The True Name is my only support. ||4||

gurmukhi: vwjy pMc sbd iqqu Gir sBwgY ]
transliteration: Vaajae Panch Sabadh Thith Ghar Sabhaagai ||
translation: The Panch Shabad, the five primal sounds, vibrate in that blessed house.

gurmukhi: Gir sBwgY sbd vwjy klw ijqu Gir DwrIAw ]
transliteration: Ghar Sabhaagai Sabadh Vaajae Kalaa Jith Ghar Dhhaareeaa ||
translation: In that blessed house, the Shabad vibrates; He infuses His almighty power into it.

gurmukhi: pMc dUq quDu vis kIqy kwlu kMtku mwirAw ]
transliteration: Panch Dhooth Thudhh Vas Keethae Kaal Kanttak Maariaa ||
translation: Through You, we subdue the five demons of desire, and slay Death, the torturer.

gurmukhi: Duir krim pwieAw quDu ijn kau is nwim hir kY lwgy ]
transliteration: Dhhur Karam Paaeiaa Thudhh Jin Ko S Naam Har Kai Laagae ||
translation: Those who have such pre-ordained destiny are attached to the Lord's Name.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku qh suKu hoAw iqqu Gir Anhd vwjy ]5]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Theh Sukh Hoaa Thith Ghar Anehadh Vaajae ||5||
translation: Says Nanak, they are at peace, and the unstruck sound current vibrates within their homes. ||5||

gurmukhi: swcI ilvY ibnu dyh inmwxI ]
transliteration: Saachee Livai Bin Dhaeh Nimaanee ||
translation: Without the true love of devotion, the body is without honor.

gurmukhi: dyh inmwxI ilvY bwJhu ikAw kry vycwrIAw ]
transliteration: Dhaeh Nimaanee Livai Baajhahu Kiaa Karae Vaechaareeaa ||
translation: The body is dishonored without devotional love; what can the poor wretches do?

gurmukhi: quDu bwJu smrQ koie nwhI ikRpw kir bnvwrIAw ]
transliteration: Thudhh Baajh Samarathh Koe Naahee Kirapaa Kar Banavaareeaa ||
translation: No one except You is all-powerful; please bestow Your Mercy, O Lord of all nature.

gurmukhi: eys nau horu Qwau nwhI sbid lwig svwrIAw ]
transliteration: Eaes No Hor Thhaao Naahee Sabadh Laag Savaareeaa ||
translation: There is no place of rest, other than the Name; attached to the Shabad, we are embellished with beauty.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku ilvY bwJhu ikAw kry vycwrIAw ]6]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Livai Baajhahu Kiaa Karae Vaechaareeaa ||6||
translation: Says Nanak, without devotional love, what can the poor wretches do? ||6||

gurmukhi: AwnMdu AwnMdu sBu ko khY AwnMdu gurU qy jwixAw ]
transliteration: Aanandh Aanandh Sabh Ko Kehai Aanandh Guroo Thae Jaaniaa ||
translation: Bliss, bliss - everyone talks of bliss; bliss is known only through the Guru.

gurmukhi: jwixAw AwnMdu sdw gur qy ikRpw kry ipAwirAw ]
transliteration: Jaaniaa Aanandh Sadha Gur Thae Kirapaa Karae Piaariaa ||
translation: Eternal bliss in known only through the Guru, when the Beloved Lord grants His Grace.

gurmukhi: kir ikrpw iklivK kty igAwn AMjnu swirAw ]
transliteration: Kar Kirapaa Kilavikh Katte Giaan Anjan Saariaa ||
translation: Granting His Grace, He cuts away our sins; He blesses us with the healing ointment of spiritual wisdom.

gurmukhi: AMdrhu ijn kw mohu qutw iqn kw sbdu scY svwirAw ]
transliteration: Andhrahu Jin Kaa Mohu Thutta Thin Kaa Sabadh Sachai Savaariaa ||
translation: Those who eradicate attachment from within themselves, are adorned with the Shabad, the Word of the True Lord.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku eyhu AnMdu hY AwnMdu gur qy jwixAw ]7]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Eaehu Anandh Hai Aanandh Gur Thae Jaaniaa ||7||
translation: Says Nanak, this alone is bliss - bliss which is known through the Guru. ||7||

gurmukhi: bwbw ijsu qU dyih soeI jnu pwvY ]
transliteration: Baabaa Jis Thoo Dhaehi Soee Jan Paavai ||
translation: O Baba, he alone receives it, unto whom You give it.

gurmukhi: pwvY q so jnu dyih ijs no hoir ikAw krih vycwirAw ]
transliteration: Paavai Th So Jan Dhaehi Jis No Hor Kiaa Karehi Vaechaariaa ||
translation: He alone receives it, unto whom You give it; what can the other poor wretched beings do?

gurmukhi: ieik Brim BUly iPrih dh idis ieik nwim lwig svwirAw ]
transliteration: Eik Bharam Bhoolae Firehi Dheh Dhis Eik Naam Laag Savaariaa ||
translation: Some are deluded by doubt, wandering in the ten directions; some are adorned with attachment to the Naam.

gurmukhi: gur prswdI mnu BieAw inrmlu ijnw Bwxw Bwvey ]
transliteration: Gur Prasaadhee Man Bhaeiaa Niramal Jinaa Bhaanaa Bhaaveae ||
translation: By Guru's Grace, the mind becomes immaculate and pure, for those who follow God's Will.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku ijsu dyih ipAwry soeI jnu pwvey ]8]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Jis Dhaehi Piaarae Soee Jan Paaveae ||8||
translation: Says Nanak, he alone receives it, unto whom You give it, O Beloved Lord. ||8||

gurmukhi: Awvhu sMq ipAwirho AkQ kI krh khwxI ]
transliteration: Aavahu Santh Piaariho Akathh Kee Kareh Kehaanee ||
translation: Come, Beloved Saints, let us speak the Unspoken Speech of the Lord.

gurmukhi: krh khwxI AkQ kyrI ikqu duAwrY pweIAY ]
transliteration: Kareh Kehaanee Akathh Kaeree Kith Dhuaarai Paaeeai ||
translation: How can we speak the Unspoken Speech of the Lord? Through which door will we find Him?

gurmukhi: qnu mnu Dnu sBu sauip gur kau hukim mMinAY pweIAY ]
transliteration: Than Man Dhhan Sabh Soup Gur Ko Hukam Manniai Paaeeai ||
translation: Surrender body, mind, wealth, and everything to the Guru; obey the Order of His Will, and you will find Him.

gurmukhi: hukmu mMinhu gurU kyrw gwvhu scI bwxI ]
transliteration: Hukam Mannihu Guroo Kaeraa Gaavahu Sachee Baanee ||
translation: Obey the Hukam of the Guru's Command, and sing the True Word of His Bani.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku suxhu sMqhu kiQhu AkQ khwxI ]9]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sunahu Santhahu Kathhihu Akathh Kehaanee ||9||
translation: Says Nanak, listen, O Saints, and speak the Unspoken Speech of the Lord. ||9||

gurmukhi: ey mn cMclw cqurweI iknY n pwieAw ]
transliteration: Eae Man Chanchalaa Chathuraaee Kinai N Paaeiaa ||
translation: O fickle mind, through cleverness, no one has found the Lord.

gurmukhi: cqurweI n pwieAw iknY qU suix mMn myirAw ]
transliteration: Chathuraaee N Paaeiaa Kinai Thoo Sun Mann Maeriaa ||
translation: Through cleverness, no one has found Him; listen, O my mind.

gurmukhi: eyh mwieAw mohxI ijin eyqu Brim BulwieAw ]
transliteration: Eaeh Maaeiaa Mohanee Jin Eaeth Bharam Bhulaaeiaa ||
translation: This Maya is so fascinating; because of it, people wander in doubt.

gurmukhi: mwieAw q mohxI iqnY kIqI ijin TgaulI pweIAw ]
transliteration: Maaeiaa Th Mohanee Thinai Keethee Jin Thagoulee Paaeeaa ||
translation: This fascinating Maya was created by the One who has administered this potion.

gurmukhi: kurbwxu kIqw iqsY ivthu ijin mohu mITw lwieAw ]
transliteration: Kurabaan Keethaa Thisai Vittahu Jin Mohu Meethaa Laaeiaa ||
translation: I am a sacrifice to the One who has made emotional attachment sweet.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku mn cMcl cqurweI iknY n pwieAw ]10]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Man Chanchal Chathuraaee Kinai N Paaeiaa ||10||
translation: Says Nanak, O fickle mind, no one has found Him through cleverness. ||10||

gurmukhi: ey mn ipAwirAw qU sdw scu smwly ]
transliteration: Eae Man Piaariaa Thoo Sadha Sach Samaalae ||
translation: O beloved mind, contemplate the True Lord forever.

gurmukhi: eyhu kutMbu qU ij dyKdw clY nwhI qyrY nwly ]
transliteration: Eaehu Kuttnb Thoo J Dhaekhadha Chalai Naahee Thaerai Naalae ||
translation: This family which you see shall not go along with you.

gurmukhi: swiQ qyrY clY nwhI iqsu nwil ikau icqu lweIAY ]
transliteration: Saathh Thaerai Chalai Naahee This Naal Kio Chith Laaeeai ||
translation: They shall not go along with you, so why do you focus your attention on them?

gurmukhi: AYsw kMmu mUly n kIcY ijqu AMiq pCoqweIAY ]
transliteration: Aisaa Kanm Moolae N Keechai Jith Anth Pashhothaaeeai ||
translation: Don't do anything that you will regret in the end.

gurmukhi: siqgurU kw aupdysu suix qU hovY qyrY nwly ]
transliteration: Sathiguroo Kaa Oupadhes Sun Thoo Hovai Thaerai Naalae ||
translation: Listen to the Teachings of the True Guru - these shall go along with you.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku mn ipAwry qU sdw scu smwly ]11]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Man Piaarae Thoo Sadha Sach Samaalae ||11||
translation: Says Nanak, O beloved mind, contemplate the True Lord forever. ||11||

gurmukhi: Agm Agocrw qyrw AMqu n pwieAw ]
transliteration: Agam Agocharaa Thaeraa Anth N Paaeiaa ||
translation: O inaccessible and unfathomable Lord, Your limits cannot be found.

gurmukhi: AMqo n pwieAw iknY qyrw Awpxw Awpu qU jwxhy ]
transliteration: Antho N Paaeiaa Kinai Thaeraa Aapanaa Aap Thoo Jaanehae ||
translation: No one has found Your limits; only You Yourself know.

gurmukhi: jIA jMq siB Kylu qyrw ikAw ko AwiK vKwxey ]
transliteration: Jeea Janth Sabh Khael Thaeraa Kiaa Ko Aakh Vakhaaneae ||
translation: All living beings and creatures are Your play; how can anyone describe You?

gurmukhi: AwKih q vyKih sBu qUhY ijin jgqu aupwieAw ]
transliteration: Aakhehi Th Vaekhehi Sabh Thoohai Jin Jagath Oupaaeiaa ||
translation: You speak, and You gaze upon all; You created the Universe.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku qU sdw AgMmu hY qyrw AMqu n pwieAw ]12]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Thoo Sadha Aganm Hai Thaeraa Anth N Paaeiaa ||12||
translation: Says Nanak, You are forever inaccessible; Your limits cannot be found. ||12||

gurmukhi: suir nr muin jn AMimRqu Kojdy su AMimRqu gur qy pwieAw ]
transliteration: Sur Nar Mun Jan Anmrith Khojadhe S Anmrith Gur Thae Paaeiaa ||
translation: The angelic beings and the silent sages search for the Ambrosial Nectar; this Amrit is obtained from the Guru.

gurmukhi: pwieAw AMimRqu guir ikRpw kInI scw min vswieAw ]
transliteration: Paaeiaa Anmrith Gur Kirapaa Keenee Sachaa Man Vasaaeiaa ||
translation: This Amrit is obtained, when the Guru grants His Grace; He enshrines the True Lord within the mind.

gurmukhi: jIA jMq siB quDu aupwey ieik vyiK prsix AwieAw ]
transliteration: Jeea Janth Sabh Thudhh Oupaaeae Eik Vaekh Prasan Aaeiaa ||
translation: All living beings and creatures were created by You; only some come to see the Guru, and seek His blessing.

gurmukhi: lbu loBu AhMkwru cUkw siqgurU Blw BwieAw ]
transliteration: Lab Lobh Ahankaar Chookaa Sathiguroo Bhalaa Bhaaeiaa ||
translation: Their greed, avarice and egotism are dispelled, and the True Guru seems sweet.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku ijs no Awip quTw iqin AMimRqu gur qy pwieAw ]13]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Jis No Aap Thuthaa Thin Anmrith Gur Thae Paaeiaa ||13||
translation: Says Nanak, those with whom the Lord is pleased, obtain the Amrit, through the Guru. ||13||

gurmukhi: Bgqw kI cwl inrwlI ]
transliteration: Bhagathaa Kee Chaal Niraalee ||
translation: The lifestyle of the devotees is unique and distinct.

gurmukhi: cwlw inrwlI Bgqwh kyrI ibKm mwrig clxw ]
transliteration: Chaalaa Niraalee Bhagathaah Kaeree Bikham Maarag Chalanaa ||
translation: The devotees' lifestyle is unique and distinct; they follow the most difficult path.

gurmukhi: lbu loBu AhMkwru qij iqRsnw bhuqu nwhI bolxw ]
transliteration: Lab Lobh Ahankaar Thaj Thrisanaa Bahuth Naahee Bolanaa ||
translation: They renounce greed, avarice, egotism and desire; they do not talk too much.

gurmukhi: KMinAhu iqKI vwlhu inkI eyqu mwrig jwxw ]
transliteration: Khanniahu Thikhee Vaalahu Nikee Eaeth Maarag Jaanaa ||
translation: The path they take is sharper than a two-edged sword, and finer than a hair.

gurmukhi: gur prswdI ijnI Awpu qijAw hir vwsnw smwxI ]
transliteration: Gur Prasaadhee Jinee Aap Thajiaa Har Vaasanaa Samaanee ||
translation: By Guru's Grace, they shed their selfishness and conceit; their hopes are merged in the Lord.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku cwl Bgqw jughu jugu inrwlI ]14]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Chaal Bhagathaa Jugahu Jug Niraalee ||14||
translation: Says Nanak, the lifestyle of the devotees, in each and every age, is unique and distinct. ||14||

gurmukhi: ijau qU clwieih iqv clh suAwmI horu ikAw jwxw gux qyry ]
transliteration: Jio Thoo Chalaaeihi Thiv Chaleh Suaamee Hor Kiaa Jaanaa Gun Thaerae ||
translation: As You make me walk, so do I walk, O my Lord and Master; what else do I know of Your Glorious Virtues?

gurmukhi: ijv qU clwieih iqvY clh ijnw mwrig pwvhy ]
transliteration: Jiv Thoo Chalaaeihi Thivai Chaleh Jinaa Maarag Paavehae ||
translation: As You cause them to walk, they walk - You have placed them on the Path.

gurmukhi: kir ikrpw ijn nwim lwieih is hir hir sdw iDAwvhy ]
transliteration: Kar Kirapaa Jin Naam Laaeihi S Har Har Sadha Dhhiaavehae ||
translation: In Your Mercy, You attach them to the Naam; they meditate forever on the Lord, Har, Har.

gurmukhi: ijs no kQw suxwieih AwpxI is gurduAwrY suKu pwvhy ]
transliteration: Jis No Kathhaa Sunaaeihi Aapanee S Guradhuaarai Sukh Paavehae ||
translation: Those whom You cause to listen to Your sermon, find peace in the Gurdwara, the Guru's Gate.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku scy swihb ijau BwvY iqvY clwvhy ]15]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sachae Saahib Jio Bhaavai Thivai Chalaavehae ||15||
translation: Says Nanak, O my True Lord and Master, you make us walk according to Your Will. ||15||

gurmukhi: eyhu soihlw sbdu suhwvw ]
transliteration: Eaehu Sohilaa Sabadh Suhaavaa ||
translation: This song of praise is the Shabad, the most beautiful Word of God.

gurmukhi: sbdo suhwvw sdw soihlw siqgurU suxwieAw ]
transliteration: Sabadho Suhaavaa Sadha Sohilaa Sathiguroo Sunaaeiaa ||
translation: This beauteous Shabad is the everlasting song of praise, spoken by the True Guru.

gurmukhi: eyhu iqn kY mMin visAw ijn Durhu iliKAw AwieAw ]
transliteration: Eaehu Thin Kai Mann Vasiaa Jin Dhhurahu Likhiaa Aaeiaa ||
translation: This is enshrined in the minds of those who are so pre-destined by the Lord.

gurmukhi: ieik iPrih Gnyry krih glw glI iknY n pwieAw ]
transliteration: Eik Firehi Ghanaerae Karehi Galaa Galee Kinai N Paaeiaa ||
translation: Some wander around, babbling on and on, but none obtain Him by babbling.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku sbdu soihlw siqgurU suxwieAw ]16]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sabadh Sohilaa Sathiguroo Sunaaeiaa ||16||
translation: Says Nanak, the Shabad, this song of praise, has been spoken by the True Guru. ||16||

gurmukhi: pivqu hoey sy jnw ijnI hir iDAwieAw ]
transliteration: Pavith Hoeae Sae Janaa Jinee Har Dhhiaaeiaa ||
translation: Those humble beings who meditate on the Lord become pure.

gurmukhi: hir iDAwieAw pivqu hoey gurmuiK ijnI iDAwieAw ]
transliteration: Har Dhhiaaeiaa Pavith Hoeae Guramukh Jinee Dhhiaaeiaa ||
translation: Meditating on the Lord, they become pure; as Gurmukh, they meditate on Him.

gurmukhi: pivqu mwqw ipqw kutMb sihq isau pivqu sMgiq sbweIAw ]
transliteration: Pavith Maathaa Pithaa Kuttnb Sehith Sio Pavith Sangath Sabaaeeaa ||
translation: They are pure, along with their mothers, fathers, family and friends; all their companions are pure as well.

gurmukhi: khdy pivqu suxdy pivqu sy pivqu ijnI mMin vswieAw ]
transliteration: Kehadhe Pavith Sunadhe Pavith Sae Pavith Jinee Mann Vasaaeiaa ||
translation: Pure are those who speak, and pure are those who listen; those who enshrine it within their minds are pure.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku sy pivqu ijnI gurmuiK hir hir iDAwieAw ]17]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sae Pavith Jinee Guramukh Har Har Dhhiaaeiaa ||17||
translation: Says Nanak, pure and holy are those who, as Gurmukh, meditate on the Lord, Har, Har. ||17||

gurmukhi: krmI shju n aUpjY ivxu shjY shsw n jwie ]
transliteration: Karamee Sehaj N Oopajai Vin Sehajai Sehasaa N Jaae ||
translation: By religious rituals, intuitive poise is not found; without intuitive poise, skepticism does not depart.

gurmukhi: nh jwie shsw ikqY sMjim rhy krm kmwey ]
transliteration: Neh Jaae Sehasaa Kithai Sanjam Rehae Karam Kamaaeae ||
translation: Skepticism does not depart by contrived actions; everybody is tired of performing these rituals.

gurmukhi: shsY jIau mlIxu hY ikqu sMjim Doqw jwey ]
transliteration: Sehasai Jeeo Maleen Hai Kith Sanjam Dhhothaa Jaaeae ||
translation: The soul is polluted by skepticism; how can it be cleansed?

gurmukhi: mMnu Dovhu sbid lwghu hir isau rhhu icqu lwie ]
transliteration: Mann Dhhovahu Sabadh Laagahu Har Sio Rehahu Chith Laae ||
translation: Wash your mind by attaching it to the Shabad, and keep your consciousness focused on the Lord.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku gur prswdI shju aupjY iehu shsw iev jwie ]18]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Gur Prasaadhee Sehaj Oupajai Eihu Sehasaa Eiv Jaae ||18||
translation: Says Nanak, by Guru's Grace, intuitive poise is produced, and this skepticism is dispelled. ||18||

gurmukhi: jIAhu mYly bwhrhu inrml ]
transliteration: Jeeahu Mailae Baaharahu Niramal ||
translation: Inwardly polluted, and outwardly pure.

gurmukhi: bwhrhu inrml jIAhu q mYly iqnI jnmu jUAY hwirAw ]
transliteration: Baaharahu Niramal Jeeahu Th Mailae Thinee Janam Jooai Haariaa ||
translation: Those who are outwardly pure and yet polluted within, lose their lives in the gamble.

gurmukhi: eyh iqsnw vfw rogu lgw mrxu mnhu ivswirAw ]
transliteration: Eaeh Thisanaa Vaddaa Rog Lagaa Maran Manahu Visaariaa ||
translation: They contract this terrible disease of desire, and in their minds, they forget about dying.

gurmukhi: vydw mih nwmu auqmu so suxih nwhI iPrih ijau byqwilAw ]
transliteration: Vaedhaa Mehi Naam Outham So Sunehi Naahee Firehi Jio Baethaaliaa ||
translation: In the Vedas, the ultimate objective is the Naam, the Name of the Lord; but they do not hear this, and they wander around like demons.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku ijn scu qijAw kUVy lwgy iqnI jnmu jUAY hwirAw ]19]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Jin Sach Thajiaa Koorrae Laagae Thinee Janam Jooai Haariaa ||19||
translation: Says Nanak, those who forsake Truth and cling to falsehood, lose their lives in the gamble. ||19||

gurmukhi: jIAhu inrml bwhrhu inrml ]
transliteration: Jeeahu Niramal Baaharahu Niramal ||
translation: Inwardly pure, and outwardly pure.

gurmukhi: bwhrhu q inrml jIAhu inrml siqgur qy krxI kmwxI ]
transliteration: Baaharahu Th Niramal Jeeahu Niramal Sathigur Thae Karanee Kamaanee ||
translation: Those who are outwardly pure and also pure within, through the Guru, perform good deeds.

gurmukhi: kUV kI soie phucY nwhI mnsw sic smwxI ]
transliteration: Koorr Kee Soe Pahuchai Naahee Manasaa Sach Samaanee ||
translation: Not even an iota of falsehood touches them; their hopes are absorbed in the Truth.

gurmukhi: jnmu rqnu ijnI KitAw Bly sy vxjwry ]
transliteration: Janam Rathan Jinee Khattiaa Bhalae Sae Vanajaarae ||
translation: Those who earn the jewel of this human life, are the most excellent of merchants.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku ijn mMnu inrmlu sdw rhih gur nwly ]20]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Jin Mann Niramal Sadha Rehehi Gur Naalae ||20||
translation: Says Nanak, those whose minds are pure, abide with the Guru forever. ||20||

gurmukhi: jy ko isKu gurU syqI snmuKu hovY ]
transliteration: Jae Ko Sikh Guroo Saethee Sanamukh Hovai ||
translation: If a Sikh turns to the Guru with sincere faith, as sunmukh

gurmukhi: hovY q snmuKu isKu koeI jIAhu rhY gur nwly ]
transliteration: Hovai Th Sanamukh Sikh Koee Jeeahu Rehai Gur Naalae ||
translation: If a Sikh turns to the Guru with sincere faith, as sunmukh, his soul abides with the Guru.

gurmukhi: gur ky crn ihrdY iDAwey AMqr AwqmY smwly ]
transliteration: Gur Kae Charan Hiradhi Dhhiaaeae Anthar Aathamai Samaalae ||
translation: Within his heart, he meditates on the lotus feet of the Guru; deep within his soul, he contemplates Him.

gurmukhi: Awpu Cif sdw rhY prxY gur ibnu Avru n jwxY koey ]
transliteration: Aap Shhadd Sadha Rehai Pranai Gur Bin Avar N Jaanai Koeae ||
translation: Renouncing selfishness and conceit, he remains always on the side of the Guru; he does not know anyone except the Guru.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku suxhu sMqhu so isKu snmuKu hoey ]21]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sunahu Santhahu So Sikh Sanamukh Hoeae ||21||
translation: Says Nanak, listen, O Saints: such a Sikh turns toward the Guru with sincere faith, and becomes sunmukh. ||21||

gurmukhi: jy ko gur qy vymuKu hovY ibnu siqgur mukiq n pwvY ]
transliteration: Jae Ko Gur Thae Vaemukh Hovai Bin Sathigur Mukath N Paavai ||
translation: One who turns away from the Guru, and becomes baymukh - without the True Guru, he shall not find liberation.

gurmukhi: pwvY mukiq n hor QY koeI puChu ibbykIAw jwey ]
transliteration: Paavai Mukath N Hor Thhai Koee Pushhahu Bibaekeeaa Jaaeae ||
translation: He shall not find liberation anywhere else either; go and ask the wise ones about this.

gurmukhi: Anyk jUnI Brim AwvY ivxu siqgur mukiq n pwey ]
transliteration: Anaek Joonee Bharam Aavai Vin Sathigur Mukath N Paaeae ||
translation: He shall wander through countless incarnations; without the True Guru, he shall not find liberation.

gurmukhi: iPir mukiq pwey lwig crxI siqgurU sbdu suxwey ]
transliteration: Fir Mukath Paaeae Laag Charanee Sathiguroo Sabadh Sunaaeae ||
translation: But liberation is attained, when one is attached to the feet of the True Guru, chanting the Word of the Shabad.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku vIcwir dyKhu ivxu siqgur mukiq n pwey ]22]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Veechaar Dhaekhahu Vin Sathigur Mukath N Paaeae ||22||
translation: Says Nanak, contemplate this and see, that without the True Guru, there is no liberation. ||22||

gurmukhi: Awvhu isK siqgurU ky ipAwirho gwvhu scI bwxI ]
transliteration: Aavahu Sikh Sathiguroo Kae Piaariho Gaavahu Sachee Baanee ||
translation: Come, O beloved Sikhs of the True Guru, and sing the True Word of His Bani.

gurmukhi: bwxI q gwvhu gurU kyrI bwxIAw isir bwxI ]
transliteration: Baanee Th Gaavahu Guroo Kaeree Baaneeaa Sir Baanee ||
translation: Sing the Guru's Bani, the supreme Word of Words.

gurmukhi: ijn kau ndir krmu hovY ihrdY iqnw smwxI ]
transliteration: Jin Ko Nadhr Karam Hovai Hiradhi Thinaa Samaanee ||
translation: Those who are blessed by the Lord's Glance of Grace - their hearts are imbued with this Bani.

gurmukhi: pIvhu AMimRqu sdw rhhu hir rMig jiphu swirgpwxI ]
transliteration: Peevahu Anmrith Sadha Rehahu Har Rang Japihu Saarigapaanee ||
translation: Drink in this Ambrosial Nectar, and remain in the Lord's Love forever; meditate on the Lord, the Sustainer of the world.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku sdw gwvhu eyh scI bwxI ]23]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sadha Gaavahu Eaeh Sachee Baanee ||23||
translation: Says Nanak, sing this True Bani forever. ||23||

gurmukhi: siqgurU ibnw hor kcI hY bwxI ]
transliteration: Sathiguroo Binaa Hor Kachee Hai Baanee ||
translation: Without the True Guru, other songs are false.

gurmukhi: bwxI q kcI siqgurU bwJhu hor kcI bwxI ]
transliteration: Baanee Th Kachee Sathiguroo Baajhahu Hor Kachee Baanee ||
translation: The songs are false without the True Guru; all other songs are false.

gurmukhi: khdy kcy suxdy kcy kcIˆ AwiK vKwxI ]
transliteration: Kehadhe Kachae Sunadhe Kachae Kachanaee Aakh Vakhaanee ||
translation: The speakers are false, and the listeners are false; those who speak and recite are false.

gurmukhi: hir hir inq krih rsnw kihAw kCU n jwxI ]
transliteration: Har Har Nith Karehi Rasanaa Kehiaa Kashhoo N Jaanee ||
translation: They may continually chant, 'Har, Har' with their tongues, but they do not know what they are saying.

gurmukhi: icqu ijn kw ihir lieAw mwieAw bolin pey rvwxI ]
transliteration: Chith Jin Kaa Hir Laeiaa Maaeiaa Bolan Peae Ravaanee ||
translation: Their consciousness is lured by Maya; they are just reciting mechanically.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku siqgurU bwJhu hor kcI bwxI ]24]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sathiguroo Baajhahu Hor Kachee Baanee ||24||
translation: Says Nanak, without the True Guru, other songs are false. ||24||

gurmukhi: gur kw sbdu rqMnu hY hIry ijqu jVwau ]
transliteration: Gur Kaa Sabadh Rathann Hai Heerae Jith Jarraao ||
translation: The Word of the Guru's Shabad is a jewel, studded with diamonds.

gurmukhi: sbdu rqnu ijqu mMnu lwgw eyhu hoAw smwau ]
transliteration: Sabadh Rathan Jith Mann Laagaa Eaehu Hoaa Samaao ||
translation: The mind which is attached to this jewel, merges into the Shabad.

gurmukhi: sbd syqI mnu imilAw scY lwieAw Bwau ]
transliteration: Sabadh Saethee Man Miliaa Sachai Laaeiaa Bhaao ||
translation: One whose mind is attuned to the Shabad, enshrines love for the True Lord.

gurmukhi: Awpy hIrw rqnu Awpy ijs no dyie buJwie ]
transliteration: Aapae Heeraa Rathan Aapae Jis No Dhaee Bujhaae ||
translation: He Himself is the diamond, and He Himself is the jewel; one who is blessed, understands its value.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku sbdu rqnu hY hIrw ijqu jVwau ]25]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sabadh Rathan Hai Heeraa Jith Jarraao ||25||
translation: Says Nanak, the Shabad is a jewel, studded with diamonds. ||25||

gurmukhi: isv skiq Awip aupwie kY krqw Awpy hukmu vrqwey ]
transliteration: Siv Sakath Aap Oupaae Kai Karathaa Aapae Hukam Varathaaeae ||
translation: He Himself created Shiva and Shakti, mind and matter; the Creator subjects them to His Command.

gurmukhi: hukmu vrqwey Awip vyKY gurmuiK iksY buJwey ]
transliteration: Hukam Varathaaeae Aap Vaekhai Guramukh Kisai Bujhaaeae ||
translation: Enforcing His Order, He Himself sees all. How rare are those who, as Gurmukh, come to know Him.

gurmukhi: qoVy bMDn hovY mukqu sbdu mMin vswey ]
transliteration: Thorrae Bandhhan Hovai Mukath Sabadh Mann Vasaaeae ||
translation: They break their bonds, and attain liberation; they enshrine the Shabad within their minds.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK ijs no Awip kry su hovY eyks isau ilv lwey ]
transliteration: Guramukh Jis No Aap Karae S Hovai Eaekas Sio Liv Laaeae ||
translation: Those whom the Lord Himself makes Gurmukh, lovingly focus their consciousness on the One Lord.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku Awip krqw Awpy hukmu buJwey ]26]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Aap Karathaa Aapae Hukam Bujhaaeae ||26||
translation: Says Nanak, He Himself is the Creator; He Himself reveals the Hukam of His Command. ||26||

gurmukhi: isimRiq swsqR puMn pwp bIcwrdy qqY swr n jwxI ]
transliteration: Simrith Saasathr Punn Paap Beechaaradhe Thathai Saar N Jaanee ||
translation: The Simritees and the Shaastras discriminate between good and evil, but they do not know the true essence of reality.

gurmukhi: qqY swr n jwxI gurU bwJhu qqY swr n jwxI ]
transliteration: Thathai Saar N Jaanee Guroo Baajhahu Thathai Saar N Jaanee ||
translation: They do not know the true essence of reality without the Guru; they do not know the true essence of reality.

gurmukhi: iqhI guxI sMswru BRim suqw suiqAw rYix ivhwxI ]
transliteration: Thihee Gunee Sansaar Bhram Suthaa Suthiaa Rain Vihaanee ||
translation: The world is asleep in the three modes and doubt; it passes the night of its life sleeping.

gurmukhi: gur ikrpw qy sy jn jwgy ijnw hir min visAw bolih AMimRq bwxI ]
transliteration: Gur Kirapaa Thae Sae Jan Jaagae Jinaa Har Man Vasiaa Bolehi Anmrith Baanee ||
translation: Those humble beings remain awake and aware, within whose minds, by Guru's Grace, the Lord abides; they chant the Ambrosial Word of the Guru's Bani.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku so qqu pwey ijs no Anidnu hir ilv lwgY jwgq rYix ivhwxI ]27]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak So Thath Paaeae Jis No Anadhin Har Liv Laagai Jaagath Rain Vihaanee ||27||
translation: Says Nanak, they alone obtain the essence of reality, who night and day remain lovingly absorbed in the Lord; they pass the night of their life awake and aware. ||27||

gurmukhi: mwqw ky audr mih pRiqpwl kry so ikau mnhu ivswrIAY ]
transliteration: Maathaa Kae Oudhar Mehi Prathipaal Karae So Kio Manahu Visaareeai ||
translation: He nourished us in the mother's womb; why forget Him from the mind?

gurmukhi: mnhu ikau ivswrIAY eyvfu dwqw ij Agin mih Awhwru phucwvey ]
transliteration: Manahu Kio Visaareeai Eaevadd Dhaathaa J Agan Mehi Aahaar Pahuchaaveae ||
translation: Why forget from the mind such a Great Giver, who gave us sustenance in the fire of the womb?

gurmukhi: Es no ikhu poih n skI ijs nau AwpxI ilv lwvey ]
transliteration: Ous No Kihu Pohi N Sakee Jis No Aapanee Liv Laaveae ||
translation: Nothing can harm one, whom the Lord inspires to embrace His Love.

gurmukhi: AwpxI ilv Awpy lwey gurmuiK sdw smwlIAY ]
transliteration: Aapanee Liv Aapae Laaeae Guramukh Sadha Samaaleeai ||
translation: He Himself is the love, and He Himself is the embrace; the Gurmukh contemplates Him forever.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku eyvfu dwqw so ikau mnhu ivswrIAY ]28]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Eaevadd Dhaathaa So Kio Manahu Visaareeai ||28||
translation: Says Nanak, why forget such a Great Giver from the mind? ||28||

gurmukhi: jYsI Agin audr mih qYsI bwhir mwieAw ]
transliteration: Jaisee Agan Oudhar Mehi Thaisee Baahar Maaeiaa ||
translation: As is the fire within the womb, so is Maya outside.

gurmukhi: mwieAw Agin sB ieko jyhI krqY Kylu rcwieAw ]
transliteration: Maaeiaa Agan Sabh Eiko Jaehee Karathai Khael Rachaaeiaa ||
translation: The fire of Maya is one and the same; the Creator has staged this play.

gurmukhi: jw iqsu Bwxw qw jMimAw prvwir Blw BwieAw ]
transliteration: Jaa This Bhaanaa Thaa Janmiaa Pravaar Bhalaa Bhaaeiaa ||
translation: According to His Will, the child is born, and the family is very pleased.

gurmukhi: ilv CuVkI lgI iqRsnw mwieAw Amru vrqwieAw ]
transliteration: Liv Shhurrakee Lagee Thrisanaa Maaeiaa Amar Varathaaeiaa ||
translation: Love for the Lord wears off, and the child becomes attached to desires; the script of Maya runs its course.

gurmukhi: eyh mwieAw ijqu hir ivsrY mohu aupjY Bwau dUjw lwieAw ]
transliteration: Eaeh Maaeiaa Jith Har Visarai Mohu Oupajai Bhaao Dhoojaa Laaeiaa ||
translation: This is Maya, by which the Lord is forgotten; emotional attachment and love of duality well up.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku gur prswdI ijnw ilv lwgI iqnI ivcy mwieAw pwieAw ]29]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Gur Prasaadhee Jinaa Liv Laagee Thinee Vichae Maaeiaa Paaeiaa ||29||
translation: Says Nanak, by Guru's Grace, those who enshrine love for the Lord find Him, in the midst of Maya. ||29||

gurmukhi: hir Awip Amulku hY muil n pwieAw jwie ]
transliteration: Har Aap Amulak Hai Mul N Paaeiaa Jaae ||
translation: The Lord Himself is priceless; His worth cannot be estimated.

gurmukhi: muil n pwieAw jwie iksY ivthu rhy lok ivllwie ]
transliteration: Mul N Paaeiaa Jaae Kisai Vittahu Rehae Lok Vilalaae ||
translation: His worth cannot be estimated, even though people have grown weary of trying.

gurmukhi: AYsw siqguru jy imlY iqs no isru saupIAY ivchu Awpu jwie ]
transliteration: Aisaa Sathigur Jae Milai This No Sir Soupeeai Vichahu Aap Jaae ||
translation: If you meet such a True Guru, offer your head to Him; your selfishness and conceit will be eradicated from within.

gurmukhi: ijs dw jIau iqsu imil rhY hir vsY min Awie ]
transliteration: Jis Dhaa Jeeo This Mil Rehai Har Vasai Man Aae ||
translation: Your soul belongs to Him; remain united with Him, and the Lord will come to dwell in your mind.

gurmukhi: hir Awip Amulku hY Bwg iqnw ky nwnkw ijn hir plY pwie ]30]
transliteration: Har Aap Amulak Hai Bhaag Thinaa Kae Naanakaa Jin Har Palai Paae ||30||
translation: The Lord Himself is priceless; very fortunate are those, O Nanak, who attain to the Lord. ||30||

gurmukhi: hir rwis myrI mnu vxjwrw ]
transliteration: Har Raas Maeree Man Vanajaaraa ||
translation: The Lord is my capital; my mind is the merchant.

gurmukhi: hir rwis myrI mnu vxjwrw siqgur qy rwis jwxI ]
transliteration: Har Raas Maeree Man Vanajaaraa Sathigur Thae Raas Jaanee ||
translation: The Lord is my capital, and my mind is the merchant; through the True Guru, I know my capital.

gurmukhi: hir hir inq jiphu jIAhu lwhw Kithu idhwVI ]
transliteration: Har Har Nith Japihu Jeeahu Laahaa Khattihu Dhihaarree ||
translation: Meditate continually on the Lord, Har, Har, O my soul, and you shall collect your profits daily.

gurmukhi: eyhu Dnu iqnw imilAw ijn hir Awpy Bwxw ]
transliteration: Eaehu Dhhan Thinaa Miliaa Jin Har Aapae Bhaanaa ||
translation: This wealth is obtained by those who are pleasing to the Lord's Will.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku hir rwis myrI mnu hoAw vxjwrw ]31]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Har Raas Maeree Man Hoaa Vanajaaraa ||31||
translation: Says Nanak, the Lord is my capital, and my mind is the merchant. ||31||

gurmukhi: ey rsnw qU An ris rwic rhI qyrI ipAws n jwie ]
transliteration: Eae Rasanaa Thoo An Ras Raach Rehee Thaeree Piaas N Jaae ||
translation: O my tongue, you are engrossed in other tastes, but your thirsty desire is not quenched.

gurmukhi: ipAws n jwie horqu ikqY ijcru hir rsu plY n pwie ]
transliteration: Piaas N Jaae Horath Kithai Jichar Har Ras Palai N Paae ||
translation: Your thirst shall not be quenched by any means, until you attain the subtle essence of the Lord.

gurmukhi: hir rsu pwie plY pIAY hir rsu bhuiV n iqRsnw lwgY Awie ]
transliteration: Har Ras Paae Palai Peeai Har Ras Bahurr N Thrisanaa Laagai Aae ||
translation: If you do obtain the subtle essence of the Lord, and drink in this essence of the Lord, you shall not be troubled by desire again.

gurmukhi: eyhu hir rsu krmI pweIAY siqguru imlY ijsu Awie ]
transliteration: Eaehu Har Ras Karamee Paaeeai Sathigur Milai Jis Aae ||
translation: This subtle essence of the Lord is obtained by good karma, when one comes to meet with the True Guru.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku hoir An rs siB vIsry jw hir vsY min Awie ]32]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Hor An Ras Sabh Veesarae Jaa Har Vasai Man Aae ||32||
translation: Says Nanak, all other tastes and essences are forgotten, when the Lord comes to dwell within the mind. ||32||

gurmukhi: ey srIrw myirAw hir qum mih joiq rKI qw qU jg mih AwieAw ]
transliteration: Eae Sreeraa Maeriaa Har Thum Mehi Joth Rakhee Thaa Thoo Jag Mehi Aaeiaa ||
translation: O my body, the Lord infused His Light into you, and then you came into the world.

gurmukhi: hir joiq rKI quDu ivic qw qU jg mih AwieAw ]
transliteration: Har Joth Rakhee Thudhh Vich Thaa Thoo Jag Mehi Aaeiaa ||
translation: The Lord infused His Light into you, and then you came into the world.

gurmukhi: hir Awpy mwqw Awpy ipqw ijin jIau aupwie jgqu idKwieAw ]
transliteration: Har Aapae Maathaa Aapae Pithaa Jin Jeeo Oupaae Jagath Dhikhaaeiaa ||
translation: The Lord Himself is your mother, and He Himself is your father; He created the created beings, and revealed the world to them.

gurmukhi: gur prswdI buiJAw qw clqu hoAw clqu ndrI AwieAw ]
transliteration: Gur Prasaadhee Bujhiaa Thaa Chalath Hoaa Chalath Nadhree Aaeiaa ||
translation: By Guru's Grace, some understand, and then it's a show; it seems like just a show.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku isRsit kw mUlu ricAw joiq rwKI qw qU jg mih AwieAw ]33]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Srisatt Kaa Mool Rachiaa Joth Raakhee Thaa Thoo Jag Mehi Aaeiaa ||33||
translation: Says Nanak, He laid the foundation of the Universe, and infused His Light, and then you came into the world. ||33||

gurmukhi: min cwau BieAw pRB Awgmu suixAw ]
transliteration: Man Chaao Bhaeiaa Prabh Aagam Suniaa ||
translation: My mind has become joyful, hearing of God's coming.

gurmukhi: hir mMglu gwau sKI igRhu mMdru bixAw ]
transliteration: Har Mangal Gaao Sakhee Grihu Mandhr Baniaa ||
translation: Sing the songs of joy to welcome the Lord, O my companions; my household has become the Lord's Mansion.

gurmukhi: hir gwau mMglu inq sKIey sogu dUKu n ivAwpey ]
transliteration: Har Gaao Mangal Nith Sakheeeae Sog Dhookh N Viaapeae ||
translation: Sing continually the songs of joy to welcome the Lord, O my companions, and sorrow and suffering will not afflict you.

gurmukhi: gur crn lwgy idn sBwgy Awpxw ipru jwpey ]
transliteration: Gur Charan Laagae Dhin Sabhaagae Aapanaa Pir Jaapeae ||
translation: Blessed is that day, when I am attached to the Guru's feet and meditate on my Husband Lord.

gurmukhi: Anhq bwxI gur sbid jwxI hir nwmu hir rsu Bogo ]
transliteration: Anehath Baanee Gur Sabadh Jaanee Har Naam Har Ras Bhogo ||
translation: I have come to know the unstruck sound current and the Word of the Guru's Shabad; I enjoy the sublime essence of the Lord, the Lord's Name.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku pRBu Awip imilAw krx kwrx jogo ]34]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Prabh Aap Miliaa Karan Kaaran Jogo ||34||
translation: Says Nanak, God Himself has met me; He is the Doer, the Cause of causes. ||34||

gurmukhi: ey srIrw myirAw iesu jg mih Awie kY ikAw quDu krm kmwieAw ]
transliteration: Eae Sreeraa Maeriaa Eis Jag Mehi Aae Kai Kiaa Thudhh Karam Kamaaeiaa ||
translation: O my body, why have you come into this world? What actions have you committed?

gurmukhi: ik krm kmwieAw quDu srIrw jw qU jg mih AwieAw ]
transliteration: K Karam Kamaaeiaa Thudhh Sreeraa Jaa Thoo Jag Mehi Aaeiaa ||
translation: And what actions have you committed, O my body, since you came into this world?

gurmukhi: ijin hir qyrw rcnu ricAw so hir min n vswieAw ]
transliteration: Jin Har Thaeraa Rachan Rachiaa So Har Man N Vasaaeiaa ||
translation: The Lord who formed your form - you have not enshrined that Lord in your mind.

gurmukhi: gur prswdI hir mMin visAw pUrib iliKAw pwieAw ]
transliteration: Gur Prasaadhee Har Mann Vasiaa Poorab Likhiaa Paaeiaa ||
translation: By Guru's Grace, the Lord abides within the mind, and one's pre-ordained destiny is fulfilled.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku eyhu srIru prvwxu hoAw ijin siqgur isau icqu lwieAw ]35]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Eaehu Sreer Pravaan Hoaa Jin Sathigur Sio Chith Laaeiaa ||35||
translation: Says Nanak, this body is adorned and honored, when one's consciousness is focused on the True Guru. ||35||

gurmukhi: ey nyqRhu myirho hir qum mih joiq DrI hir ibnu Avru n dyKhu koeI ]
transliteration: Eae Naethrahu Maeriho Har Thum Mehi Joth Dhharee Har Bin Avar N Dhaekhahu Koee ||
translation: O my eyes, the Lord has infused His Light into you; do not look upon any other than the Lord.

gurmukhi: hir ibnu Avru n dyKhu koeI ndrI hir inhwilAw ]
transliteration: Har Bin Avar N Dhaekhahu Koee Nadhree Har Nihaaliaa ||
translation: Do not look upon any other than the Lord; the Lord alone is worthy of beholding.

gurmukhi: eyhu ivsu sMswru qum dyKdy eyhu hir kw rUpu hY hir rUpu ndrI AwieAw ]
transliteration: Eaehu Vis Sansaar Thum Dhaekhadhe Eaehu Har Kaa Roop Hai Har Roop Nadhree Aaeiaa ||
translation: This whole world which you see is the image of the Lord; only the image of the Lord is seen.

gurmukhi: gur prswdI buiJAw jw vyKw hir ieku hY hir ibnu Avru n koeI ]
transliteration: Gur Prasaadhee Bujhiaa Jaa Vaekhaa Har Eik Hai Har Bin Avar N Koee ||
translation: By Guru's Grace, I understand, and I see only the One Lord; there is no one except the Lord.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku eyih nyqR AMD sy siqguir imilAY idb idRsit hoeI ]36]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Eaehi Naethr Andhh Sae Sathigur Miliai Dhib Dhrisatt Hoee ||36||
translation: Says Nanak, these eyes were blind; but meeting the True Guru, they became all-seeing. ||36||

gurmukhi: ey sRvxhu myirho swcY sunxY no pTwey ]
transliteration: Eae Sravanahu Maeriho Saachai Sunanai No Pathaaeae ||
translation: O my ears, you were created only to hear the Truth.

gurmukhi: swcY sunxY no pTwey srIir lwey suxhu siq bwxI ]
transliteration: Saachai Sunanai No Pathaaeae Sreer Laaeae Sunahu Sath Baanee ||
translation: To hear the Truth, you were created and attached to the body; listen to the True Bani.

gurmukhi: ijqu suxI mnu qnu hirAw hoAw rsnw ris smwxI ]
transliteration: Jith Sunee Man Than Hariaa Hoaa Rasanaa Ras Samaanee ||
translation: Hearing it, the mind and body are rejuvenated, and the tongue is absorbed in Ambrosial Nectar.

gurmukhi: scu AlK ivfwxI qw kI giq khI n jwey ]
transliteration: Sach Alakh Viddaanee Thaa Kee Gath Kehee N Jaaeae ||
translation: The True Lord is unseen and wondrous; His state cannot be described.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku AMimRq nwmu suxhu pivqR hovhu swcY sunxY no pTwey ]37]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Anmrith Naam Sunahu Pavithr Hovahu Saachai Sunanai No Pathaaeae ||37||
translation: Says Nanak, listen to the Ambrosial Naam and become holy; you were created only to hear the Truth. ||37||

gurmukhi: hir jIau guPw AMdir riK kY vwjw pvxu vjwieAw ]
transliteration: Har Jeeo Gufaa Andhr Rakh Kai Vaajaa Pavan Vajaaeiaa ||
translation: The Lord placed the soul to the cave of the body, and blew the breath of life into the musical instrument of the body.

gurmukhi: vjwieAw vwjw paux nau duAwry prgtu kIey dsvw gupqu rKwieAw ]
transliteration: Vajaaeiaa Vaajaa Poun No Dhuaarae Pragatt Keeeae Dhasavaa Gupath Rakhaaeiaa ||
translation: He blew the breath of life into the musical instrument of the body, and revealed the nine doors; but He kept the Tenth Door hidden.

gurmukhi: gurduAwrY lwie BwvnI ieknw dsvw duAwru idKwieAw ]
transliteration: Guradhuaarai Laae Bhaavanee Eikanaa Dhasavaa Dhuaar Dhikhaaeiaa ||
translation: Through the Gurdwara, the Guru's Gate, some are blessed with loving faith, and the Tenth Door is revealed to them.

gurmukhi: qh Anyk rUp nwau nv iniD iqs dw AMqu n jweI pwieAw ]
transliteration: Theh Anaek Roop Naao Nav Nidhh This Dhaa Anth N Jaaee Paaeiaa ||
translation: There are many images of the Lord, and the nine treasures of the Naam; His limits cannot be found.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku hir ipAwrY jIau guPw AMdir riK kY vwjw pvxu vjwieAw ]38]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Har Piaarai Jeeo Gufaa Andhr Rakh Kai Vaajaa Pavan Vajaaeiaa ||38||
translation: Says Nanak, the Lord placed the soul to the cave of the body, and blew the breath of life into the musical instrument of the body. ||38||

gurmukhi: eyhu swcw soihlw swcY Gir gwvhu ]
transliteration: Eaehu Saachaa Sohilaa Saachai Ghar Gaavahu ||
translation: Sing this true song of praise in the true home of your soul.

gurmukhi: gwvhu q soihlw Gir swcY ijQY sdw scu iDAwvhy ]
transliteration: Gaavahu Th Sohilaa Ghar Saachai Jithhai Sadha Sach Dhhiaavehae ||
translation: Sing the song of praise in your true home; meditate there on the True Lord forever.

gurmukhi: sco iDAwvih jw quDu Bwvih gurmuiK ijnw buJwvhy ]
transliteration: Sacho Dhhiaavehi Jaa Thudhh Bhaavehi Guramukh Jinaa Bujhaavehae ||
translation: They alone meditate on You, O True Lord, who are pleasing to Your Will; as Gurmukh, they understand.

gurmukhi: iehu scu sBnw kw Ksmu hY ijsu bKsy so jnu pwvhy ]
transliteration: Eihu Sach Sabhanaa Kaa Khasam Hai Jis Bakhasae So Jan Paavehae ||
translation: This Truth is the Lord and Master of all; whoever is blessed, obtains it.

gurmukhi: khY nwnku scu soihlw scY Gir gwvhy ]39]
transliteration: Kehai Naanak Sach Sohilaa Sachai Ghar Gaavehae ||39||
translation: Says Nanak, sing the true song of praise in the true home of your soul. ||39||

gurmukhi: Andu suxhu vfBwgIho sgl mnorQ pUry ]
transliteration: Anadh Sunahu Vaddabhaageeho Sagal Manorathh Poorae ||
translation: Listen to the song of bliss, O most fortunate ones; all your longings shall be fulfilled.

gurmukhi: pwrbRhmu pRBu pwieAw auqry sgl ivsUry ]
transliteration: Paarabreham Prabh Paaeiaa Outharae Sagal Visoorae ||
translation: I have obtained the Supreme Lord God, and all sorrows have been forgotten.

gurmukhi: dUK rog sMqwp auqry suxI scI bwxI ]
transliteration: Dhookh Rog Santhaap Outharae Sunee Sachee Baanee ||
translation: Pain, illness and suffering have departed, listening to the True Bani.

gurmukhi: sMq swjn Bey srsy pUry gur qy jwxI ]
transliteration: Santh Saajan Bheae Sarasae Poorae Gur Thae Jaanee ||
translation: The Saints and their friends are in ecstasy, knowing the Perfect Guru.

gurmukhi: suxqy punIq khqy pivqu siqguru rihAw BrpUry ]
transliteration: Sunathae Puneeth Kehathae Pavith Sathigur Rehiaa Bharapoorae ||
translation: Pure are the listeners, and pure are the speakers; the True Guru is all-pervading and permeating.

gurmukhi: ibnvMiq nwnku gur crx lwgy vwjy Anhd qUry ]40]1]
transliteration: Binavanth Naanak Gur Charan Laagae Vaajae Anehadh Thoorae ||40||1||
translation: Prays Nanak, touching the Guru's Feet, the unstruck sound current of the celestial bugles vibrates and resounds. ||40||1||
